columns.comment: This flag controls exception processing on sequence values.  If yes and the sequences are numeric, then the sequences are checked to make sure the value is within the Max Sequence Tolerance.

columns.name: isMergeSchedules

columns.name: isSendSequenceWithInvoice
columns.comment: This flag controls if the sequence list will be included in the invoice EDI document.

columns.name: maximumTolerance
columns.comment: The maximum number that is allowed between sequence values.  This value is only checked if the sequence is a numeric value and the Check Sequence Tolerance is yes.
columns.description: If sequence tolerance is required, use this field to set maximum tolerance acceptable

columns.description: Specify how automated processes create inventory allocations for production requirements. Available options are Detail or General

columns.description: When set to Yes, this field automatically assign lot numbers to lot controlled items.

columns.name: issuePolicy
columns.description:
Specifies how the system issues inventory quantites to production and whether they appear on functions such as Production Order Receipt, Production Order Component Issue or Operation Activity Transaction. Options are as follows (and will vary by item):
No Issue = Do not Issue to production
Backflush = Backflush transfer to production
Direct = Direct Issue to production

columns.name: lastAverage
columns.description: System Displays last date average was calculated

columns.name: lastCount
columns.description: System Displays last date cycle counted

columns.name: location
columns.description: For finished items - enter RTS, for purchased, raw, packaged materials, and containers enter 4WALL. For WIP items, enter the work centre location where the items are stored. For subcontract items, enter the supplier code where the items are processed. All these entries must be first set up in Location

columns.name: locationType
columns.description: Optionally, enter a code defining specific location types.

columns.name: lotSerialControl
columns.description: Leave blank for non lot/serial controlled items. Enter L for lot controlled and S for serial controlled items. If you have entered M under serial control in item inventory, this field will automatically default to S for serial controlled.

columns.name: pickPolicy
columns.description:
Specifies how the system processes items to satisfy production using either Production Order Picklist or Bulk Item (Transfer) Picklist and works in conjunction with the Issue Policy field. Options are as follows (and will vary by item):
No Pick = Do not pick
Transfer = Pick and Transfer
Issue = Pick and Issue

columns.name: pickingMaximum
columns.description: The maximum quantity for an item on a production order picklist. This is an optional field and will vary by item.

columns.name: pickingMinimum
columns.description: The minimum quantity for an item on a production order picklist. This is an optional field and will vary by item.

columns.name: pickingMultiple
columns.description: The multiple for determining the quantity on a production order picklist. This is an optional field and will vary by item

columns.name: pickingOrderAscending
columns.description: Defaults from Inventory Control\nAscending = Pick Oldest or lowest number first.\nDescending = Pick Newest or highest number first

columns.name: pickingOrderChar
columns.comment: Production Picking Order. It's used in the dropdown list.
columns.description:
Specify the picking sequence to be used when detail allocating stock to production orders.
0 = Default (from Inventory Control File)
1 = Location
2 = Lot/Serial
3 = Date
4 = Expiry Date

columns.name: transferAllocationPolicy
columns.description: Specfy the transfer allocation policy for items. Available options are Keep and Drop. \nKeep: Retain detail allocations for the item & production order post completion of the picklist transfer - this would be used when the lot/serial quantites to be issued or backflushed are the same as the lot/serial quantities to be picked and transfer using production picklists. \nDrop: Drop detailed allocations for the item & production order post completion of the picklist transfer - this would be used when the lot/serial quantites to be issued or backflushed are independant from the lot/serial quantities to be picked and transfered using production picklists.

columns.name: customerCode
columns.comment: The address code of customer for item replacement
columns.description: Optionally, enter the customer for whom this up-sell item should be active. Leave blank to indicate the system should up-sell item where appropriate on orders created for any customer.

columns.description: Enter the date this record should be activated. This field can not be left blank.

columns.comment: End effective date for the replacement.
columns.description: Optionally, enter end effective date to cessation of up-sell requirements.

columns.description: Indicates if this item is the default up-sell item

columns.description: Enter the item number for which you are defining an up-sell item.

columns.name: itemQuantity
columns.comment: Quantity of existing item to be replaced
columns.description: Enter the quantity of the item being up-sold

columns.name: preference
columns.comment: Preference in which this record will be displayed in selection window.
columns.description: Optionally, enter a number to indicate the order of the preferred up-sell item replacement. Entering 1 indicates this up-sell item replacement is your first choice for a replacement.

columns.name: reference
columns.description: Optionally, enter any pertinent reference information.

columns.name: roundQuantity
columns.comment: Round Quantity, depending on the value.
columns.description: This field defaults from Item Replacement Control and indicates the rounding method to use when non-whole number replacement items quantities are encountered.

columns.name: siteCode
columns.description: Optionally, enter the site where this up-sell item record should be active. Leave blank to indicate the item should be replaced at all sites.

columns.name: upSellItemCode
columns.comment: Item number to use as a replacement

columns.name: upSellQuantity
columns.comment: Quantity of new item that replaces standard quantity of old item
columns.description: Enter the quantity of the up-sell item. The replacement quantity can not be 0.

columns.comment: Location used for backflushing at this work center.
columns.description: Location used for backflushing at this work center.

columns.comment: A code used to group work centers for reporting.

columns.comment: The description of the work center.
columns.description: Enter description of work centre codes

columns.name: domainCode
columns.comment: The business domain for this data.
columns.description: The business domain for this data.

columns.name: horizonEndDate
columns.description: Specify either Day, Week or Month as the horizon end for this work centre. Field is only accessed when workbenches are enabled in Sites.

columns.name: horizonEndNoPeriods
columns.description: Specify either Day, Week or Month as the horizon end for this work centre. Field is only accessed when workbenches are enabled in Sites.

columns.name: horizonEndPeriod
columns.description: Specify either Day, Week or Month as the horizon end for this work centre. Field is only accessed when workbenches are enabled in Sites.

columns.name: isAutoFirm
columns.comment: Controls whether the auto firm process will firm planned orders for this work center.
columns.description: Specify Yes to have the system automatically firm orders scheduled at this work centre.

columns.name: laborBurdenPercent
columns.comment: The percentage of the labor rate added into burden.
columns.description: Enter the labour burden % applicable to the total labour cost at this work centre. This figure is used in item cost calculations.

columns.name: laborBurdenRate
columns.comment: The labor burden rate per hour charged to this work center.
columns.description: Enter the labour burden rate per hour applicable to both set up and run time at this work centre. This figure is used in item cost calculations

columns.name: laborRate
columns.comment: The average labor rate paid per hour in this work center.
columns.description: Enter the average labour rate paid per labour hour to run this work centre. This figure is used in item cost calculations

columns.name: lastAutoFirmDate
columns.comment: The date when the auto firm process was last run for the work center.
columns.description: Optionally, enter a date of the last auto firm by select start and end date form the drop down icon

columns.name: machineBurdenRate
columns.comment: The machine burden rate per hour added into burden.
columns.description: Enter the burden rate per hour applicable to machine run time and set up at this work centre. This figure is used in item cost calculations.

columns.name: machineCode
columns.comment: A code used to identify a machine in this work center.

columns.name: machinesPerOperation
columns.comment: The number of machines used simultaneously for operations in this W/C.
columns.description: Can more than one machine work at the same time to process a given operation? If so, enter the number of machines here. 99% will be set to 1

columns.name: machinesPerWorkCenter
columns.comment: The number of machines at this work center.
columns.description: Enter the total number of machines (or people) in this work centre. The total capacity for a work centre is calculated by multiplying the number of working hours, defined in the shop calendar for each work centre, by the number of machines. Do not confuse this field with the number of machines that operate at the same time - this is entered in the Mach/Op field.

columns.name: queueDays
columns.comment: The number of days for queue
columns.description: Do items queue at this work centre prior to the work being processed? If so, enter the time in decimal hours. 99% will be set to 0

columns.name: queueHMS
columns.comment: The number of hours, minutes and seconds for queue
columns.description: The number of hours, minutes and seconds for queue

columns.name: runCrew
columns.comment: The run crew needed for this machine.
columns.description: Enter the number of people required to run this work centre. As this is a reference only field and no scheduling or cost calculations use this field, recommend leaving this set to 0.

columns.name: schedulerCode
columns.comment: Code used to identify scheduler responsible for this work center.
columns.description: Optionally, enter ID of scheduler responible for this work centre

columns.name: setupCrew
columns.comment: The number of workers used for setup at this work center / machine.
columns.description: Enter the number of people required to set up this work centre. As this is a reference only field and no scheduling or cost calculations use this field, recommend leaving this set to 0

columns.name: setupLaborRate
columns.comment: The labor setup rate used at this workcenter.
columns.description: Enter the average labour rate paid per labour hour to set up this work centre. This figure is used in item cost calculations

columns.name: supplierCode
columns.comment: Supplier code associated with this work center.
columns.description: Supplier code associated with this work center.

columns.name: transactionQuantityMethod
columns.comment: The language detail value indicating the method used to calculate transaction quantity.
columns.description: The language detail value indicating the method used to calculate transaction quantity

columns.name: waitDays
columns.comment: The number of days for wait
columns.description: Do items wait at this work centre prior to moving on to the next process? If so, enter the time in decimal hours. 99% will be set to 0

columns.name: waitHMS
columns.comment: The number of hours, minutes and seconds for wait
columns.description: The number of hours, minutes and seconds for wait

columns.name: workCenterCode
columns.comment: The code identifying this work center.
